inscription:
{Yu_ sareba
Saho no kawara no
kawakaze ni
tomo nodowase te
chidori nakunari

As evening falls across
the bank of the Saho River
on the breeze
comes the sould of a plover
crying for its companion.
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper with embossing
portfolio: From Untitled series of Thirty-six Poetic Immortals (Sanjūrokkasen 三十六歌仙)
provenance: Louis V. Ledoux (until 1948); Roland Koscherak (around 1948); Richard P. Gale (until 1974)
title: Poem by Ki no Tomonori
